website_summaries.verdict: The reaction of people towards the 940 v4 has been positive. This New Balance running shoe efficiently averts the unpleasant effects of overpronation. In fact, the stability mechanisms are highlighted by those with pronation concerns. The irritating in-shoe environment is considered the caveat.Fans of road running shoes for irregular foot pronation can enjoy the New Balance 940 v4.
pros: Most people believe that the overall quality of the materials used for the New Balance 940 v4 is agreeable
Those who have overpronated motion of the foot consider the pronation-correcting capacities of this stability running shoe as efficient
Some have stated that the cushioning system of this product is supportive and comfortable
This running shoe also works well as apparel for strolling through the urban environments, according to testers
Based on a couple of comments, the upper unit is breathable enough to welcome all-day wear
cons: A few people have felt a wobbly interior environment when wearing the 940 v4
The inner sleeve of this product rubs uncomfortably against the skin of the foot, based on a handful of reviews

customer_reviews.title: Very good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am a 70 year old man w coronary heart disease. I walk 6 miles a day in these shoes. They are a favorite brand and this pair did not disappoint me. I purchase larger shoes to help protect my feet. These r a little larger than when I ordered same in past. I wish a similar shoe w a thicker forefoot sole was available.
customer_reviews.author: Rolland mambourg

customer_reviews.title: Go to long distance running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a take off from the discontinued 1260 series, which were my favorites running shoes for many years. For me good combination of overpronation/cushioning, yet light weight enough for long runs. 4 stars instead of 5, because front/toe area a bit to wide for me.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Laskov

customer_reviews.title: V4. Is a no go.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the 940s for a few years and love them. However with the ending of the 940v3 so went the love affair. I wore the v4's for a week and my knees are KILLING me. It's now time to find a newer version of a new shoe. Sad to have to give them up.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Folsom

customer_reviews.title: Factory defect
customer_reviews.text: The right shoe is bigger than the left shoe, although they are both allegedly the same size. They are both 12.5 4E, but the right one is over 1/2 inch of space in the shoe. I have 3 other pairs of New Balance in this size. They all fit perfectly. Now I have a pair with two different sizes. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: personal opinion
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. the difference in these from the previous version is significant. the previous version has the leather trim around the toe on the outside. This one has the trim on the INSIDE. It looks better, but it feels terrible. Its not as tall, last version was approximately and inch and this one was maybe a half inch. it was annoying to the feel of the toe and definitely would not have the reinforcement that you would need. The toe would easily wear a hole in the shoe. This may or may not bother others, but for him, it was a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: D. Oakes

customer_reviews.title: A New Balance failure
customer_reviews.text: I've worn New Balance shoes for many years, so I was interested in trying this model. What a piece of junk! Poor materials, a sole that squeaked with every step, and absolutely no foot support at all. The New Balance statement that "The 940v4 stability running shoe from New Balance is made for over pronators" is just plain false. It makes the problem worse, not better. This Is a shoe to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: By The Sea

customer_reviews.title: Flat hard shoe with no support
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice wide NB - However it does not have any arch support and by the end of my 8 hour work day (nurse) I could barely walk my feet hurt so bad. I will try a insole to see if they are salvageable but will not buy again. Love my 1080V from NB and are worth the extra money. These were not worth the discount and felt like a $20 shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marney

customer_reviews.title: Hardend toe material warps causing rubbing/blisters
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few versions of this shoe and have always been pretty happy, but are pretty poor. The material used in the toe is hardened, which one would think would be good, but instead is the source of the problem. Wearing the shoe causes creases to form along the sides and front of the toe area. These invariably rub against your toes and in my case has caused a few blisters. I definitely would NOT recommend buying these.
customer_reviews.author: ShawnInCO

customer_reviews.title: Back-To-Back NB Purchases... Still A Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: Just be sure to get the wide! I don't have a particularly wide foot, but without the wide version, there was a lot of pressure on the top of my foot even with the laces fully untied. Once I returned the normal and got the wide, I fell back in love with these great running shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stein

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a bit more toe room
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would try the XX for more toe room. My feet, as most, flat out as we age. the X size had become a bit tight in the toe area. These shoes have more than ample room, perhaps a bit too much. Very comfortable, but when put to the test my feet move around quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves them!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is picky and loves these for the treadmill. They are great quality and attractive. We ordered a couple of different pairs and he chose these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor design?
customer_reviews.text: I have been a New Balance fan for years, as their better models typically offer the support needed for my overpronation and plantar fascistic. While this sneaker does provide the support needed, the toe of the sneaker seems to have a very thin plastic which forms the toe. That wouldn't be a problem except the plastic "ripples" around the toe of the shoe. Well, little ripples by your toes are a bad thing, as one of them caught my toenail and ripped it half off. To make matters worse, when it grew back, I developed an ingrown toenail. Really disappointed with the construction of the sneaker, and of course it's too late to return. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joel L.

customer_reviews.title: Best version of the 940 yet
customer_reviews.text: Wider toe box and better cushioning than v3. I have problem feet and this shoe improved the cushioning in forefoot and arch areas, and it is significantly wider (4E) than v 3. A winner and I found a lucky price on it for once
customer_reviews.author: Penacious H

customer_reviews.title: Um no...
customer_reviews.text: Got a used pair of New Balance tennis shoes that look nothing like the picture. The box came with an amazon warehouse sticker. I bought these new and not from amazon warehouse. How did that happen??? See pics.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Q

customer_reviews.title: Great for working on your feet
customer_reviews.text: Having purchased the previous version of this shoe, I was worried that this model would be too different from it's predecessor that's worked so well for me. Not only was this shoe a perfect fit, but I feel as if there's more support in the heel, which is great since I work on my feet all day. Overall a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe for pronation
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a beat up pair of 1260 v6 that I’ve worn for two years. Don’t run but NB running shoes for pronation are my go to for comfort and durability. These 940s fit well and are good for my daily wear
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Good buy worth the 80 dollars
customer_reviews.text: Nice sneakers very strong I wear a 12 but got a 12 and a half it's a little lose but I'll just wear double socks or put some napkins in the base.. Really good for power walking very comfortable wide sneakers
customer_reviews.author: del  a p

customer_reviews.title: So glad someone still has big sizes and narrow widths.
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to find size 16 Narrow shoes of any kind. Glad that New Balance still sells them. Really like the 940's, a little more up to date style than other NB athletic shoes I have.
customer_reviews.author: dl

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty severe over pronation and these shoes correct it well. I’ve been pretty exclusively wearing brooks beasts for the last few years and decided to give these a try. I still prefer the brooks, but for the price difference these work well
customer_reviews.author: Chris Paslay

customer_reviews.title: Nice but...
customer_reviews.text: It looks great on picture but when received I was disappointed to see how huge it is for me. It large to it's size. I can't really tell anything because i did not even used it. I gave it to my relative.
customer_reviews.author: Herminio C. Miguel

customer_reviews.title: My husband keeps raving about these shoes
customer_reviews.text: He loves the weight and the firm foundation they provide. He is a former runner and a shoe connoisseur, most exclusively New Balance, and these are probably his favorites - ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if I'd classify this as a 'running shoe'.
customer_reviews.text: Quite heavy thick soles on this shoe takes it out of the classification as a running shoe. It might make a decent walking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Darin L. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Very stable running shoe
customer_reviews.text: This model is great for my running style and my body type. At 6ft+ and extra wide foot I struggle finding good shoes that last. I love going back to NB and this stable platform shoe is perfect for long runs or long hikes.
customer_reviews.author: david hudson

customer_reviews.title: It looks too big for US 11 2E size
customer_reviews.text: I have used the 2019 version of this shoe, which was simply great. I did not like it because 1. It looks too big for US 11 2E size and as compared to 2019 version of the same size 2. Can't return it as I have used it a couple of times
customer_reviews.author: Arvind Tiwari

customer_reviews.title: This is my "go-to" sneaker.
customer_reviews.text: I love these sneakers. I keep buying them when my old NB are too ratty. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: happybuyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of New Balance 940 V3 used for 5.5 mile walks 3-4 times weekly. I also need a 8 4E size. This newer 940 V4 model fits great and with a slight roomier toe box versus the 940 V3. Overall great!
customer_reviews.author: David Haas

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little big
customer_reviews.text: Great Shoe! It does appear to run a little big. I wear a 15 in most shoes including past New Balance, but returned this one and reordered in a 14 in the grey blue option.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Wolfington

customer_reviews.title: A good New Balance shoe
customer_reviews.text: The 940's are a good shoe for me, but the 990's and 1540's are better. I am a senior fitness walker and prefer to have more support and substance than the 940's give. I am not sure if they will be as durable as the 990's or 1540's. Still at this price point, I feel quite satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul N. DeLand

customer_reviews.title: as described
customer_reviews.text: Great, comfortable shoes. Look fantastic, light weight but with great support. Very good shoe and fit as should.
customer_reviews.author: kevin h.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and good fitting shoe
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair. Wider foot and they are perfect shoes in 2E
customer_reviews.author: P. Reader

customer_reviews.title: Ankle pain from overpronation solved.
customer_reviews.text: A great running shoe for overpronators. Light weight with a great style.
customer_reviews.author: hmann46

customer_reviews.title: Box was damaged
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to let you know that this shoe box was very banged up and damaged when it arrived. I'm returning them because of the size but I thought you'd like to know about the box damage as well. The shoes didn't seem to be affected from the damage. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Might run large
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 11.5 x-wide but it was one size to big. I exchanged it and it’s fine now. The sole is stiff which suits my running style.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WALKING SHOES!!
customer_reviews.text: if you walk or run a lot, this shoe may be best choice out there. Extremely comfortable. I put over 200 miles on them last month and they were always refreshing to wear. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Happy happy
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great shoe with max stability. Lots of room compared to other brands. You don't have to order up a size for runners.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Happy as I can be!
customer_reviews.text: They fit very well, the last is not as wide as the 1260 models. I’m hopeful New Balance will provide something with that large last for pronation.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Tufo

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find shoes!
customer_reviews.text: We buy New Balance every time! Great shoe, great product! My husband wears a 17 4E! They are hard to find!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L

customer_reviews.title: The shoes fit.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit perfectly and had the cushion I needed.
customer_reviews.author: dennis puffer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves this shoe. He uses them to do workouts and walking. Fits great and very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea henderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes 👟
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are comfortable and true to size. Look exactly like the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Faucette

customer_reviews.title: Alleviated tendonitis
customer_reviews.text: I'm flat footed, and am currently suffering from Posterior Tibial Tendonitis from working on my feet for 8 hours a day. My orthotics were too hard and caused inflammation. I ordered these shoes based on the reviews and I couldn't be happier. They fit my flat feet very well, with and extra large toe box. They have arch support that I can feel, and have been the best support and comfort out of any other shoes that I've tried or that I own. I also like the styling. I will be buying multiple pairs.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Highy recommend to anyone who has to stand for hours
customer_reviews.text: My feet are in pretty bad shape from wearing bad shoes while standing for many hours at work. I could tell the difference after day one of wearing these New Balances. I’ve now worn them at work for 5 days and obviously there is still some pain but I’ve noticed a huge difference! I think these shoes might save my life!! I’ll definitely be buying another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's 940v4 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Push your runs to the limit, not your feet. The 940v4 stability running shoe from New Balance is made for over pronators. This runner is designed with a high-density medial post, T-BEAM technology for torsional stability in the shoe and ABZORB cushioning.
feature_bullets: 12 mm drop; due to variances created during the development and manufacturing processes, all references to 12 mm drop are approximate
ABZORB midsole absorbs impact through a combination of cushioning and compression resistance
Dual density post offers added stability
